website_summaries.verdict: An affordable and lightweight stove that offers a lot of stability and protection from the wind.
pros: Weighs 3.3 ounces, and is 2.8 by 3.8 inches folded
Easy to use with a propane canister, and easy to adjust, even with gloves on
Get up to an hour burn time on a canister
Boils a liter of water in 3.5 minutes
cons: Some buyers say that this option doesn't fold down small enough, and that it doesn't fit well in its carrying box

customer_reviews.title: Works well, carrying case is weird.
customer_reviews.text: Good product! Bought this as an alternative to the $40 MSR one, because I'm cheap. Definitely worked as expected. My only gripe is that it's a triangle shape and the carrying box that comes with it is a square, for some odd reason. It fits, but not well, and could pop open at any second. Seems to be an oversight.
customer_reviews.author: Sephris

customer_reviews.title: Price-to-Performance is great.
customer_reviews.text: It works well, is made well, and is the exact copy of MRS's Pocket Rocket, at a fraction of the cost. It functions almost par, and I have no complaints. Edit: I thought I would add this. The stove's threaded portion has a brass insert that should last it a long time. Cheap stoves tend to be all aluminum, but not this one. If the stove base that screws into lindal valve is all aluminum, there is a greater chance to cross-thread it, if not wear out faster.
customer_reviews.author: Pope Zeke IV

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: The Monoprice Pocket Backpacking Stove works well and is a great value. I'd say it's equivalent to much more costly similar stoves except for the lack of an igniter. I've had so many igniters fail across time on various camping devices that I pretty much expect to use a lighter anyway, so no problem there. I've used a range of Monoprice products over the years (mostly relating to electronics), and have always found them to be well made, affordable, and of great value, and this stove is definitely in that category.
customer_reviews.author: AZ123

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing weighs like nothing and takes up like zero space in your backpack. Even with a lot of wind, it put out a nice, consistent, flame.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great budget stove!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this stove before on the Appalachian Trail and it proves itself over and over as a great budget stove. Yes, it is weighty, but the even flame distribution and the durability makes th he extra weight worthwhile. I will continue to enjoy this stove as I hit the A.T. again.
customer_reviews.author: j e creek

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much ordered a second one.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! And the cost is very fair, I bought this as a prep for my dehydrated food and so far have kept it in my kitchen for making tea in about 3 min, it’s made very well and I liked it so much I ordered another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really well made stove for the price
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great for the price. The materials used feel solid and the machining is clean. If you like the original pocket rocket design, this is pretty darn close. Had no problems with it at 10k feet. Just like the pocket rocket this stove is best suited to boiling water pretty fast. I'm using about 5g of butane for a 2 cup boil at 70 degrees. Mine weighs in at 3.5 oz and the case weighs 1.5 oz.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Better quality than most of the other affordable small stoves. Since the arms don't multi-fold they are able to open wide and sturdy. Better than the super floppy ultra fold up kind.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Must have when eating rough
customer_reviews.text: This is a super light but solidly built stove. I was very impressed with how sturdy this adapter is and how well it simmers using jetboil fuel. My only frustration is how much fuel leaks out each time I screw the stove on or off the fuel canister. Other than that an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Mine wouldn’t turn the gas off.
customer_reviews.text: Couldnt get mine to turn off. Turned into a little fireball.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M.

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected
customer_reviews.text: Did not expect much to anything for the price, but thought it was cheap enough to give it a shot. This thing works as well as my MSR which was $70. Will be buying an additional one.
customer_reviews.author: jujitsu

customer_reviews.title: Seems well-made, but time'll tell.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well-made, time will tell but from the looks of it it'll be excellent for my purposes; solo camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: This little stove is incredible have brought it on a few backpacking trips already!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Best deal
customer_reviews.text: Best deal out there for a small light stove. Constructed very well and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Haven't "used" it yet, but immediately hooked it up and lit it. Strong flame and easy adjustment. Fuel canisters a LOT less expensive at Walmart.....
customer_reviews.author: michael bowman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This is one cool little stove. Glad I bought it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great little stove!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little stove and the windshield actually work in a light wind!
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Minischetti

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really great product!! Solid construction. Must better & much cheaper then my MSR pocket rocket.
customer_reviews.author: ectech1

customer_reviews.title: n
customer_reviews.text: novel. not sure it fujian or wheeger. keeps the yurt warm.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stove
customer_reviews.text: Used this stove on our trip to UP/Pictured Rocks. Worked as expected with a strong flame. Fairly resistant to wind - doesn't blow out. Good, stable pot support. Flame lifted off burner at high settings until the burner got hot. Cools reasonably quickly. A bit heavier and larger than some stoves, but fewer moving parts, and thicker/stronger metal gives me more confidence.
customer_reviews.author: kludge

product_meta.title: Monoprice Pocket Backpacking Stove Ideal for Camping and Backpacking - Pure Outdoor Collection
product_meta.description: Heat water for coffee or cook your food on the trail using this Pure Outdoor pocket Backpacking Stove. This simple stove uses a fuel canister for it's base, making it a compact and simple solution for backpacking and camping. It can burn for up to an hour using an 8 oz. fuel canister and can boil a liter of water in only 3 minutes 30 seconds. The unique burner design features a flame shield, which helps prevent the flame from being extinguished by strong breezes. It supports up to 15 lbs., yet weighs only 3.6 oz, making it an easy, lightweight addition to your trail gear.
feature_bullets: Folding down to a compact 2.8" x 3.8" and weighing only 3.3 oz., the Pure Outdoor Pocket Backpacking Stove is easy to take on your outdoor adventures.
This is no complicated assembly, no priming, preheating, or pressurizing required. Simply attach it to a gas canister, light it, and start cooking.
Fully-Adjustable: The wire flame control is easy to adjust from a simmer to full boil, even with gloved hands.
Flame Protection: The unique flame shield ensures that the flame will not be extinguished, even in a strong breeze.
